title: [Large-Scale] ICT Integration Strategies in Higher Education: Strengthening Learner Competencies in Science

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and experience in utilizing digital tools
context.additional_context: Students require experiences in ICT-enabled collaboration and creative problem-solving in science, with a demand for instructors' effective ICT integration examples

learning_goals: Learners visualize ≥3 sets of scientific experiment data (heatmaps, scatter plots, etc.) using Python’s Matplotlib, Pandas, and Tableau within a 4-week intermediate course and write a 500-word report on data trend analysis.

Learners form a team of three peers using online collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Notion), perform a PBL project over four weeks, submit two weekly reports and one final presentation, and achieve ≥80 points based on a comprehensive evaluation (30% peer assessment, 70% instructor assessment).
Learners develop a 5-item rubric for assessing scientific creativity using ICT tools (Google Forms, Padlet, etc.) over three weeks, apply it to ≥3 peer projects, and submit an analysis report.

resources: BYOD-compatible Software (e.g., Virtual Labs, Collaboration Tools)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
